- Website<br>&nbsp;

- Interactive exercises<br>&nbsp;

- Student assignments<br>&nbsp;

- Demo/support apps<br>&nbsp;
:::

## Components of an R-based data science class

:::{.small-font}
- Slides with code and output<br>[xaringan / beamer / ...]{.highlight}

- Website<br>[distill / blogdown / ...]{.highlight}

- Interactive exercises<br>[learnr]{.highlight}

- Student assignments<br>[RMarkdown templates]{.highlight}

- Demo/support apps<br>[shiny apps]{.highlight}
:::

::: {.fragment .small-font}
Many of these technologies pose challenges
:::


## Example of the types of challenges we may encounter

::: {.fragment .small-font}
We can use **learnr** for interactive exercises
:::

:::{.fragment .small-font}
But:
:::

:::{.incremental .small-font}
- The **learnr** package requires a running webserver
- Alternatively, students can run learnr documents locally<br>
  (confusing and ugly)
:::
